articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's largest private property developer, Country Garden (2007.HK), faces a deadline for making interest payments on two U.S. dollar bonds on Tuesday, just days after dodging an onshore debt default with a last-minute payment extension deal.
articles.title: Country Garden faces second debt challenge in days as offshore payment comes due

articles.author: Julie Zhu, Kevin Huang, Yelin Mo, Roxanne Liu
articles.description: China is set to launch a new state-backed investment fund that aims to raise about $40 billion for its semiconductor sector, two people familiar with the matter said, as the country ramps up efforts to catch up with the U.S. and other rivals.
articles.title: Exclusive: China to launch new $40 bln state fund to boost chip industry, sources say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Walt Disney (DIS.N) on Monday said it is hopeful that Charter Communications (CHTR.O) will be ready to have more conversations to reach a distribution deal that will restore access to Disney's content and urged Spectrum customers to switch to Hulu's live service to access channels blacked out on Charter.
articles.title: Disney asks Spectrum customers to switch to Hulu+ amid Charter dispute

articles.author: Steve Scherer
articles.description: Canada is struggling to get a key tool in place for major carbon capture and storage (CCS) projects, said a representative of one of the largest such ventures, as the country seeks to launch incentives vital to cutting emissions from Alberta's oil sands.
articles.title: Exclusive: Canada oil sands carbon capture project struggles to get key contract

articles.author: David Randall
articles.description: U.S. stock fund flows into and out of the healthcare sector have swung wildly from week to week lately, as investors have adjusted their bets over how long the economy will stay strong.
articles.title: Analysis: US healthcare stocks roiled by investor tug of war over economy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Huawei Technologies and China's top chipmaker SMIC (0981.HK) have built an advanced 7-nanometer processor to power its latest smartphone, according to a teardown report by analysis firm TechInsights.
articles.title: Teardown of Huawei's new phone shows China's chip breakthrough

articles.author: Lisa Mattackal, Medha Singh
articles.description: For venture capitalists, the scars of bitcoin's disastrous 2022 run deep.
articles.title: Cryptoverse: Venture capital still haunted by crypto chaos

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Excerpts from 17 phone calls placed in early July by Russian soldiers fighting in Ukraine - and intercepted by Ukrainian intelligence services - show them complaining about poor equipment and heavy losses.
articles.title: Ukrainian intercepts show Russian soldiers’ anger at losses, disarray

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Cuba has uncovered a human trafficking ring that has coerced its citizens to fight for Russia in the war in Ukraine, its foreign ministry said on Monday, adding that Cuban authorities were working to "neutralize and dismantle" the network.
articles.title: Cuba uncovers human trafficking of Cubans to fight for Russia in Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. first lady Jill Biden has tested positive for COVID-19 just days before President Joe Biden, who tested negative for the virus, is due to travel to a Group of 20 summit in India, the White House said on Monday.
articles.title: Jill Biden positive for COVID, President Biden tests negative -White House
